content.raw:
So I don't really have a problem with making `six` a dependency. I bring this up because our [exception raising code](#!/philipstarkey/qtutils/pull-requests/2/python-3/diff#Lqtutils/invoke_in_main.pyF98) is not as good as that in `six` and I'd rather not leave in corner case bugs in exception handling!

We could not import six, and just do what they do in [`reraise`](https://github.com/benjaminp/six/blob/master/six.py#L683), but basically everyone has six installed, so I think we may as well use it.
content.html:
So I don't really have a problem with making six a dependency. I bring this up because our exception raising code is not as good as that in six and I'd rather not leave in corner case bugs in exception handling!

We could not import six, and just do what they do in reraise, but basically everyone has six installed, so I think we may as well use it.
